messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Hideyoshi as Naidaijin
messages.msgSnippet: On 7-11-1585, Sadaijin Hashiba Hideyoshi was made kanpaku . So on 10 March 1585 Hideyoshi was made Nadaijin, then on 11 July of the same year Kanpaku. So,
messages.messageBody:
"On 7-11-1585, Sadaijin Hashiba Hideyoshi was made kanpaku".

So on 10 March 1585 Hideyoshi was made Nadaijin, then on 11 July of the same year Kanpaku. So, when was he made Sadaijin?
M.Lorimer

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Hideyoshi as Naidaijin
messages.msgSnippet: To Tony, Much appreciated M.Lorimer Anthony J. Bryant  wrote: ... In the start of 1585, Nijô Akizane (1556-1619) was sadaijin, but in
messages.messageBody:
To Tony,
Much appreciated
M.Lorimer

"Anthony J. Bryant" <ajbryant@...> wrote:
Michael Lorimer wrote:
> Could anyone out there be so good as to be of assistance? In1585 Hideyoshi
> was elevated to the court position of Naidaijin; therefore inferior to the
> Udaijin, Sadaijin, and above them the Dajo Daijin. Could anyone tell me who
> held those positions at that particular time? Thanks in advance

In the start of 1585, Nijô Akizane (1556-1619) was sadaijin, but in that year he
was also made kanpaku (an office he later resumed in 1615) but resigned it in
Hideyoshi's favor a few months later.

In 1585, the udaijin was Kikutei Harusue (1542-1617). It was Harusue who
proposed Hideyoshi take the office of kanpaku.

On 7-11-1585, Sadaijin Hashiba Hideyoshi was made kanpaku.

Tony

--

Anthony J. Bryant

messages.subject: Hideyoshi as Naidaijin
messages.msgSnippet: Could anyone out there be so good as to be of assistance? In1585 Hideyoshi was elevated to the court position of Naidaijin; therefore inferior to the Udaijin,
messages.messageBody:
Could anyone out there be so good as to be of assistance? In1585 Hideyoshi was elevated to the court position of Naidaijin; therefore inferior to the Udaijin, Sadaijin, and above them the Dajo Daijin. Could anyone tell me who held those positions at that particular time?
Thanks in advance
M.Lorimer
